mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Declines an invitation for the New Hampshire Convention due to "circumstances of a private nature"; proclaims success of the Democratic Party in November; commends Pierce as the right choice for the Democratic nomination. Printed in Auchampaugh. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1852 August 16, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to John H. George, George W. Morrison, A.B. Williamson, George H. Pierce and O.J.A. Vaughan; Committee of Arrangements
